intro: Hibbertia barrettiae, commonly known as the Barretts hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its striking orange-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is found in regions of Western Australia. Hibbertia barrettiae has narrow, linear leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers that attract nectar-feeding birds and insects. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant color and unique appearance.
